definition: unspoken rules (usually ones that codify improper behaviors such as leveraging guanxi to get favorable treatment, or coercing employees for sexual favors)
hidden/secret/latent/to hide/to conceal/to submerge/to dive
compass/a rule/regulation/to admonish/to plan/to scheme
variant of 規|规[gui1]
(conjunction used to express contrast with a previous clause) but/then/standard/norm/principle/to imitate/to follow/classifier for written items

sentences.english: Our problem is, bribery has become a hidden regulation of society connivance.
sentences.chinese: 我们的问题是，行贿受贿成为社会默认的潜规则。
贵公司的潜规则是什么？

sentences.english: The latent regulation embeds in the normal regulation and in the traditional culture.
sentences.chinese: 潜规则交易嵌于正式规则和传统文化当中。

sentences.english: Depressingly, these market-distorting shenanigans are part of a pattern.
sentences.chinese: 令人沮丧的是，这些扭曲市场的诡计成了潜规则。

sentences.english: Baidu's entertainment spirit is to do away with hidden rules and regulations, and let the talented have the opportunity.
sentences.chinese: 打破潜规则，让有才的人有机会，是百度娱乐的精神。

sentences.english: Do your job well, and you can sleep with sexy movie stars who depend on you.
sentences.chinese: 混得好的话，你可以潜规则那些有求于你的性感女星。

sentences.english: Hidden rules always cost a lot, some of them are not retrievable.
sentences.chinese: 其实潜规则也要付出代价的，有些根本无法挽回。

sentences.english: In addition to what's highlighted in the company handbook, what are the unwritten rules?
sentences.chinese: 除了公司手册中的要点之外，还有哪些潜规则？

sentences.english: I think there must be some hidden rules that you do not know.
sentences.chinese: 你听说最近发生在大学里的潜规则丑闻了么？

sentences.english: This is the principle behind Japanese style homes.
sentences.chinese: 这就是日本式家园的潜规则。

definition: covert activities (election rigging etc)/under-the-table manipulations/black operations
hidden details/dirty tricks/dark secrets
inside story/non-public information/behind the scenes/internal
unwritten (rule)
see 暗箱操作[an4 xiang1 cao1 zuo4]
lit. to enter by the back door/fig. to gain influence by pull or unofficial channels/back door or under the counter connections
favoritism shown to sb because of the influence of the person's wife or other female relative/(by extension) favoritism towards relatives, friends or associates
to bend the rules/to skirt around the issue
culture of honoring contractual obligations
noxious winds, evil influences (idiom); malignant social trends
The higher ups have policies while the lower downs have their own ways of getting around them. (idiom)
pinyin: shang4 you3 zheng4 ce4 , xia4 you3 dui4 ce4

definition: lit. the weak are prey to the strong (idiom); fig. predatory behavior/the law of the jungle
officialdom/bureaucracy
entertainment world/show business
to select sb for a position without announcing the decision until later/to decide behind closed doors/all cut and dried
chaos/madness
